flow.descriptionCdata:
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.11a3531d-38c3-408e-977a-9d0a7ead3e7b.prompt=Enter a value for dnsServer f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.1efd508e-8915-4f36-888d-c0fbc90726df.description=
Generates an HTML table from a list of data.

Inputs\:
    tableData - The list to generate the table from
    columnDelimiter - A delimiter that separates between columns in the tableData
    rowDelimiter - A delimiter that separates between rows in tableData

Returns\:
    An HTML-formatted table

Responses\:
   success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.35d94c9c-d419-438b-aa01-3b49021b2846.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.42c90b55-e0c7-40ee-9ebd-2c82e5aaa9ce.prompt=Enter a value for domain f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.4c68ad2c-bbe1-4129-8218-2f5dd4eb3ab8.prompt=Notification option\: f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.5c4660b0-7bb7-4e03-8b23-20aca7f29a9b.description=
Allows a user to select how they will be notified of the outcome of a flow. 

Inputs\:
    notifydata -  The message to be displayed / the content of the email / the text to be saved to file
    notifyMethod - The notification method (file, email, display). This value is case-insensitive
    subject - A description of the notification
    destination - For file\: the file to write to; for email\: the email address to send to. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email or Write to File.
    notificationServer - The name of the server to notify (e.g. an email server) if the method selected is to a server. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
    from - The originator of the message (email "from" address). This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
    serverPort - The port on which the server is running. This field used when notifyMethod is Email, and is optional (defaults to 25 if not specified)
    htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully

Note\: Some inputs are required for certain types of notification methods. In order to schedule a flow that uses this flow, all the required fields for the given notification method must be supplied. For example, if "notifyMethod" is "File", then the "destination" input must also be specified.
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.6a6430b9-9cac-4122-9321-92d77bb5e53d.description=
Allows a user to select how they will be notified of the outcome of a flow. 

Inputs\:
    notifydata -  The message to be displayed / the content of the email / the text to be saved to file
    notifyMethod - The notification method (file, email, display). This value is case-insensitive
    subject - A description of the notification
    destination - For file\: the file to write to; for email\: the email address to send to. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email or Write to File.
    notificationServer - The name of the server to notify (e.g. an email server) if the method selected is to a server. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
    from - The originator of the message (email "from" address). This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
    serverPort - The port on which the server is running. This field used when notifyMethod is Email, and is optional (defaults to 25 if not specified)
    htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully

Note\: Some inputs are required for certain types of notification methods. In order to schedule a flow that uses this flow, all the required fields for the given notification method must be supplied. For example, if "notifyMethod" is "File", then the "destination" input must also be specified.
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.71874c6a-0c42-4562-8bb4-3ee4742664d3.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup.

Inputs\:
    domain - The name of the domain to find the domain controller for
    dnsServer - The DNS server to query

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully

Returns\:
The fully qualified host name of the PDC.
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.95b5765a-adf5-447e-8f08-ed4f21ebd26c.description=
Retrieves the DN of the root domain in active directory.

Inputs\:
    host - An active directory domain controller
    altuser - The user to be used to authenticate with the host
    altpass - The password for altuser

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully

Results\:
    domainDN - the distinguished name of the root domain
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.af24cf13-fab8-4ec6-ba37-44fdaff6dd55.description=
Allows a user to select how they should be notified of the outcome of a flow, and shows them a message in that way.

Inputs\:
notifyData -  The text of the notification message.
notifyMethod - The method of notification (Write to File, Email, Display or None). This value is case-insensitive.
subject - A description of what the notification is about. 
destination - The destination of the notification (email address or filename). This field is required when notifyMethod is Email or Write to File.
notificationServer - The email server to send the notification through. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
from - The originator of the message (email "from" address).This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
serverPort - The port the service to notify on the server is running on. This field used when notifyMethod is Email, and it is optional (it defaults to 25 if not specified).
htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.

Responses\:
success - The user was notified.
failure - Notification failed.

As mentioned above, some inputs are required for certain types of notification methods. In order to schedule a flow that in turn uses this flow, all of the required fields for the given notification method must be supplied, or else the flow will not be able to execute to completion. For example, if "notifyMethod" is "File", then the "destination" input must also be specified.
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.b9c11b2b-f7ce-4f35-88bb-6e13922379be.prompt=Notification Method\: f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.bbaa7497-d80e-4118-8dd3-469e3544c19e.description=
Finds all users who have not logged in the last "daysOld" number of days.

Inputs\:
    host - A domain controller to enumerate all domain controllers from
    DN - The Distinguished Name to read users from
    baseDN - The base DN of your domain. For example, DC\=domain,DC\=com for domain.com.
    username - The username to use for LDAP queries
    password - The password to use for LDAP queries
    daysOld - Positive integer, representing the number of days that have passsed since the user logged in, in order to be considered active.

Output\:
    InactiveUsers - A table containing the distinguished names, and the last login times of the inactive users. The first column is distinguished named. The rows are | delimited, and the columns are ; delimited.

Additional Outputs\:
    InactiveUsers -  A table containing the distinguished names, and the last login times of the inactive users
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.bcf43b60-6923-4201-b794-e09cec64beec.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\:
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.c36202a7-be06-4bb7-a2b7-8b41a6b32aab.prompt=Domain\:
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.cae55b5f-ae30-4038-b49d-5d7cbe4bd380.prompt=Notification option\:
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup and find all users who have not logged in recently.

Inputs\:
    domain - The name of the domain whose domain controller you want to find
    dnsServer - The DNS server to query
    altuser - The username to use when authenticating to the primary domain controller
    altpass - The password for altuser
    DN - The Distinguished Name of the Organization Unit containing the users to be reviewed
    daysOld - The maximum number of days passed since the user logged in, in order to still be considered active
    notifyMethod - How to notify the user of the results of the flow

Outputs\: 
    Displays a summary of the flow's results

Responses\:
    success - No inactive users were found
    diagnosed - Inactive users were found
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully




f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.e2ff02fa-e019-4772-97da-e6ae2ec8c6d7.prompt=Notification option\:
f579c69a-c8a7-4030-877b-3e8893060942.f4787c91-9e3a-497e-a96a-e4d3fe8d73f7.prompt=DNSserver\:
flow.name: Find Inactive Users

staticBinding.value: The flow 'Find Inactive Users' Attempted to run, but an unknown error occurred.
All the users have been active in the last ${daysOld} days.
Inactive Users Found in Active Directory
The following users have not been active in the last ${daysOld} days. ${table}
Inactive Users Found in Active Directory
